text: The 2022 season is the Tampa Bay Buccaneers' 47th season in the National Football League (NFL) and their first under head coach Todd Bowles. It was the final year that Tom Brady played football for this team as he retired in the offseason. https://www.thecrimson.com/article/2023/2/16/tom-brady-retirement- nfl/#:~:text=After%20only%20his%20third%20season,attention%20—%20both%20negative%20and%20positive. == Regular season == === Schedule === Week Date Time () Opponent Result Record Stadium 1 September 11 8:20 p.m. at Dallas Cowboys W 19–3 1–0 AT&T; Stadium 2 September 18 1:00 p.m. at New Orleans Saints W 20–10 2–0 Caesars Superdome 3 September 25 4:25 p.m. Green Bay Packers L 12–14 2–1 Raymond James Stadium 4 October 2 8:20 p.m. Kansas City Chiefs L 31–41 2–2 Raymond James Stadium 5 October 9 1:00 p.m. Atlanta Falcons W 21–15 3–2 Raymond James Stadium 6 October 16 1:00 p.m. at Pittsburgh Steelers L 18–20 3–3 Acrisure Stadium 7 October 23 1:00 p.m. at Carolina Panthers L 3–21 3–4 Bank of America Stadium 8 8:15 p.m. Baltimore Ravens L 22–27 3–5 Raymond James Stadium 9 November 6 4:25 p.m. Los Angeles Rams W 16–13 4–5 Raymond James Stadium 10 November 13 9:30 a.m. Seattle Seahawks W 21–16 5–5 Allianz Arena 11 Bye 12 November 27 1:00 p.m. at Cleveland Browns L 17–23 5–6 FirstEnergy Stadium 13 8:15 p.m. New Orleans Saints W 17–16 6–6 Raymond James Stadium 14 December 11 4:25 p.m. at San Francisco 49ers L 7–35 6–7 Levi's Stadium 15 December 18 4:25 p.m. Cincinnati Bengals L 23–34 6–8 Raymond James Stadium 16 December 25 8:20 p.m. at Arizona Cardinals W 19–16 7–8 State Farm Stadium 17 January 1 1:00 p.m. Carolina Panthers W 30–24 8–8 Raymond James Stadium 18 January 8 1:00 p.m. at Atlanta Falcons Mercedes-Benz Stadium == Notes == * Intra-division opponents are in bold text. == References == Category:Tampa Bay Buccaneers Tampa
